Hell.name: Hell
Hell.description: A network that attacks itself and others

Deva.name: Deva
Deva.description: A comfortable network that avoids growth

forms.name: The Inferno
forms.pattern: Undifferentiated rage. When you're hurt, everything burns. You don't target - you explode. The people closest to you get caught in the blast radius. Afterward, there may be remorse, but the pattern repeats.
forms.building: A scorched earth. Relationships that cannot survive your intensity. A reputation that precedes you. Eventually, isolation - not because people leave, but because they learn not to come close.
forms.networkSignature: Volatile hub. Connections form and break rapidly. High-intensity bonds that burn out. People either orbit at safe distance or get consumed.
forms.shadow: The vulnerability underneath. The Inferno doesn't want to feel the pain that triggers the explosion, so it converts pain to rage instantly. There's something you're protecting that you won't let yourself know about.
forms.exit: The gap. Between stimulus and explosion, there's a microsecond. The practice is to find it and widen it. Not to stop the anger - to slow the conversion from hurt to harm.
forms.instruction: When the fire rises, locate the wound beneath it. Name the hurt before it becomes harm. "I am hurt" can replace the explosion.

forms.name: The Scorcher
forms.pattern: Targeted cruelty. You know exactly where the wound is, and when you're activated, you go for it. This isn't blind rage - it's precision. You've learned people's vulnerabilities and you use them.
forms.building: A legacy of harm that people don't forget. Unlike The Inferno, your damage is specific and memorable. People who've been Scorched carry the mark. You're building a network that fears you.
forms.networkSignature: Intimate knowledge weaponized. You form close bonds because you need information. The closer someone gets, the more ammunition you gather.
forms.shadow: You were Scorched too. Someone taught you that intimacy is dangerous, that knowledge of another person is power over them. You do unto others what was done to you.
forms.exit: The choice point. You KNOW what you're about to say. You can feel the word forming that will devastate. The practice is to feel the satisfaction you'd get from saying it - and let that feeling be enough.
forms.instruction: The cruel word is not required. Feel the power of holding the weapon without using it. This is actual strength.

forms.name: The Spreader
forms.pattern: Triangulation. Your hatred doesn't attack directly - it creates conflict between others. "Did you hear what they said about you?" You position yourself as innocent while lighting fires around you.
forms.building: A network of enemies who don't know you're the source. Drama that you observe from safe distance. Eventually, when the pattern is recognized, total exclusion.
forms.networkSignature: Broker of conflict. You connect people in ways that harm them. Information flows through you, transformed into weapons.
forms.shadow: Direct expression feels too dangerous. You learned that showing your own anger brought consequences, so you found a way to express it through others. The fire is still yours.
forms.exit: Owning the anger. When you feel the urge to "just mention" something inflammatory, ask: what am I actually angry about? Who am I actually angry at?
forms.instruction: Say what you mean to who you mean. Direct conflict is cleaner than the poison you're spreading.

forms.name: The Glacier
forms.pattern: Complete emotional shutdown. When activated, you become unreachable. Silent treatment. Days, weeks, years of frozen absence. Punishment through withdrawal.
forms.building: Relationships where others live in fear of your disappearance. A pattern where connection is conditional on never triggering you. Eventual abandonment by those who can't tolerate the uncertainty.
forms.networkSignature: Presence/absence oscillation. When you're present, bonds form. When you withdraw, people are left holding connections to nothing.
forms.shadow: The heat underneath the ice. The Glacier is frozen rage - anger so dangerous-feeling that it had to be completely suppressed. The withdrawal is protection for others from what you're afraid you'd do if you stayed.
forms.exit: Staying in the room. The practice isn't to stop being angry - it's to be angry AND present. To feel the freeze beginning and choose to remain, even silently, even for five more minutes.
forms.instruction: Withdrawal is violence too. Your absence speaks. Stay in the room and let them see your cold - it's less damaging than your disappearance.

forms.name: The Bitter
forms.pattern: Frozen resentment that never thaws. You remember everything. Every slight catalogued, every betrayal preserved in perfect detail. The mental ledger of grievances grows, never shrinks.
forms.building: A prison of memory. A present permanently poisoned by the past. Relationships where new people pay for old debts they don't owe.
forms.networkSignature: Long memory, short forgiveness. People learn that any wrong, however small, will be held forever. Trust becomes impossible because the ledger never clears.
forms.shadow: The original wound that taught you to remember. Someone hurt you badly enough that you decided never to be vulnerable again. Now vigilance masquerades as wisdom.
forms.exit: The cost accounting. Not forgiveness - that may be too far. But asking: what is it costing me to maintain this grievance? What would I have if I wasn't carrying this?
forms.instruction: Resentment is a coal you hold hoping the other person feels the burn. Open your hand. Let it fall. See what's left of your palm.

forms.name: The Numb
forms.pattern: Hatred so completely suppressed it became absence. You don't feel anger because you don't feel much of anything. Dissociation as permanent residence.
forms.building: A life at half-volume. Relationships where you're present but not there. A growing gap between the world and your experience of it.
forms.networkSignature: Ghost node. Technically connected, functionally absent. People feel you receding even when you're in the room.
forms.shadow: The enormous rage underneath the numbness. You didn't kill your anger - you buried it alive. It's still consuming energy to keep it down.
forms.exit: Sensation as entry point. Not trying to feel emotions directly - that path is blocked. Instead: cold water, strong tastes, physical intensity. The body as door back to feeling.
forms.instruction: The numbness is not peace. Somewhere in you, there's something that would like to scream. Find a safe place and let sound come out - any sound. Thaw from the edges.

forms.name: The Judge
forms.pattern: Constant evaluation. Everyone is measured. Everyone falls short. Standards exist that no human can meet, and you apply them relentlessly - to others and to yourself.
forms.building: A world where nothing is good enough. Relationships where people feel perpetually failing. A perfectionism that guarantees disappointment.
forms.networkSignature: Hierarchical connections based on merit assessment. People are ranked. Movement is possible but rarely upward.
forms.shadow: The judgment you received. Someone measured you and found you wanting. Now you hold the measuring stick, but you're still the one being measured.
forms.exit: Noticing the evaluation happening. Not stopping it - just noticing. "I am evaluating this person right now." Making the automatic conscious.
forms.instruction: For one day, practice seeing without ranking. Not "this is good/bad" but simply "this is." The compulsion to judge is not truth - it's a wound speaking.

forms.name: The Executioner
forms.pattern: Punishment as justice. When someone crosses the line, they deserve consequences, and you are qualified to deliver them. Cancel, destroy, end - righteously.
forms.building: A network governed by fear of execution. People who perform acceptability rather than risk your judgment. And eventually, your own execution when someone decides you've crossed their line.
forms.networkSignature: Enforcement hub. You're the one who decides who's in and who's out. Power held through threat of expulsion.
forms.shadow: The part of you that deserves execution. The Executioner is often hardest on others for crimes they unconsciously know they've committed themselves.
forms.exit: Proportionality check. Before acting: is this response proportional to the offense? Or is this about something else, something older?
forms.instruction: You are not qualified to destroy anyone. Consequences, yes. Justice, perhaps. Annihilation, never. What would mercy look like here?

forms.name: The Ruminant
forms.pattern: The thought spiral that won't release. 3am replays of conversations. What you should have said. What they must have meant. The mental hamster wheel that never stops.
forms.building: A mind that can't be present because it's always rehearsing the past. Relationships distorted by the stories you build in the replay. Exhaustion from the endless mental processing.
forms.networkSignature: Over-processing of social data. Every interaction gets analyzed for threat. Every message parsed for hidden meaning. People feel examined rather than known.
forms.shadow: The need to control through understanding. If you can just figure it out, you'll be safe. But the figuring never completes because the threat was never intellectual.
forms.exit: Pattern interrupt. Not trying to solve the loop - that's more looping. Instead: body movement, cold water, speaking to another human. Breaking the circuit physically.
forms.instruction: The answer is not in your head. After 10 minutes of rumination, the thinking is not helping - it's the problem. Move your body. Get out of the loop.

forms.name: The Self-Flagellant
forms.pattern: Self-punishment as permanent residence. You've done wrong - maybe specifically, maybe existentially - and you make sure you suffer for it. No amount of atonement clears the debt.
forms.building: A life of diminished permission. You don't deserve good things, so you don't let them in. A strange loyalty to suffering that feels like integrity but is actually self-destruction.
forms.networkSignature: Receiving is blocked. People can give to you but you can't take in. Connection is one-way; you pour out, nothing comes back.
forms.shadow: The original verdict. Someone told you that you were wrong - not that you did wrong, but that you ARE wrong. You internalized the judge and now you carry out the sentence.
forms.exit: Questioning the verdict. Not "I didn't do anything wrong" - but "Is perpetual punishment actually helping anyone? What would be enough?"
forms.instruction: You have suffered enough for this. The debt is paid or was never real. One day, try letting in something good without paying for it first.

forms.name: The Glutton
forms.pattern: More, more, more. Past the point of satisfaction, past the point of pleasure, past the point of pain. The next bite, drink, scroll, hit - when enough is never enough.
forms.building: Tolerance and escalation. What satisfied once doesn't anymore, so you need more. A body and mind shaped by excess. Diminishing returns on increasing consumption.
forms.networkSignature: Consumption as connection. Relationships organized around shared indulgence. Enabling bonds. People who would challenge the pattern are pushed away.
forms.shadow: The emptiness that consumption is trying to fill. The Glutton isn't hungry for food - they're hungry for something that food can't provide. But the eating continues because stopping would mean feeling what's actually there.
forms.exit: Finding the enough. Not restriction - that creates backlash. Instead: can you find the moment when satisfaction arrives, and recognize it? Can you feel the turn from pleasure to numbness?
forms.instruction: Stop mid-bite and ask: am I still enjoying this? Feel for the moment when more becomes less. That moment is your teacher.

forms.name: The Connoisseur
forms.pattern: Sophisticated craving. You don't want just anything - you want the best. Quality over quantity. But the quest for quality never ends, and the satisfaction window is getting narrower.
forms.building: A refined prison. Ever more specific requirements for contentment. A world where fewer and fewer things meet your standards. Excellence as cage.
forms.networkSignature: Curation as identity. Relationships with people who share or admire your discernment. Status through taste.
forms.shadow: The desire for MORE disguised as desire for BETTER. The Connoisseur thinks they're above the Glutton, but the mechanism is identical - just wearing nicer clothes.
forms.exit: Enjoying the ordinary. Not abandoning quality - but noticing when "this isn't good enough" is actually "I don't want to stop wanting."
forms.instruction: Something mediocre cannot hurt you. Let a good-enough thing be good enough. What you're really looking for isn't available for purchase.

forms.name: The Addict
forms.pattern: Craving that has become compulsion. The distance between impulse and action has collapsed. You know you don't want to do this, and you do it anyway.
forms.building: Loss of agency. A life increasingly organized around the compulsion. Relationships strained by broken promises. A future that keeps getting smaller.
forms.networkSignature: Enabler/savior oscillation. People either help you use or try to save you. Genuine peer connection gets squeezed out.
forms.shadow: The pain the addiction is managing. Addiction is not the problem - it's a solution to a problem you don't know how to face. The substance/behavior is keeping something at bay.
forms.exit: Not stopping (yet) - that may require help. But asking: what is this managing? What would I feel if I couldn't do this? Getting curious about what's underneath.
forms.instruction: You are using this to survive something. Honor that before trying to stop. When you can name what you're surviving, you can find another way to survive it.

forms.name: The Collector
forms.pattern: Acquisition as identity. The things you own, the experiences you've had, the credentials you've accumulated - these are who you are. And there's always more to collect.
forms.building: A museum of yourself that still doesn't capture you. An ever-growing display that requires ever-growing maintenance. The exhausting work of keeping up with your own image.
forms.networkSignature: Collections attract collectors. Your relationships are with people who are also building museums. Mutual admiration of acquisitions.
forms.shadow: The empty space the collecting is trying to fill. If you stop acquiring, you might have to face who you are when you're not adding to the pile.
forms.exit: Subtracting. Not as punishment, but as experiment. What if you had less? What would you be without this particular item/credential/experience?
forms.instruction: Give something away that you've been keeping. Let something go. Feel what's left. That's closer to who you actually are.

forms.name: The Climber
forms.pattern: Position obsession. Where you sit in the hierarchy. Who knows your name. What your title says. Social position as primary life project.
forms.building: A life oriented around a game you can't win. There's always a higher rung, and even at the top, the fear of falling. Security that never arrives because position must be constantly defended.
forms.networkSignature: Strategic connections. Relationships evaluated for what they can do for your position. Up, down, or lateral - everyone is positioned.
forms.shadow: The worthlessness underneath the climbing. The Climber believes that if they stop ascending, they'll be revealed as nothing. The climbing is proof against an internal verdict of emptiness.
forms.exit: Lateral living. Not giving up achievement - but asking: what would I do if status wasn't the point? Who would I spend time with if positioning wasn't the goal?
forms.instruction: Sit at the low table on purpose. See how it feels. The terror you expect might not come - and if it does, that terror is what you're actually running from.

forms.name: The Influencer
forms.pattern: Visibility as food. Being seen, known, followed, attended to. The metrics of attention: likes, followers, engagement. Your daily bread.
forms.building: An image that requires constant feeding. An identity that exists in others' perception. Dependency on attention that means you're never at peace alone.
forms.networkSignature: Broadcast mode. One to many. Lots of audience, less genuine relationship. The difference between fans and friends is blurring.
forms.shadow: The invisibility you're trying to outrun. Someone didn't see you, or saw you and rejected what they saw. Now being seen feels like survival.
forms.exit: Private moments. Doing something without documenting it. Having an experience you don't share. Letting something be just for you.
forms.instruction: Go 24 hours without posting anything. Feel what comes up. The hunger you feel is the actual information.

forms.name: The Browser
forms.pattern: Looking without committing. Endless scrolling, endless options, endless tabs. Always researching, never doing. The next thing might be better, so you never land on this thing.
forms.building: A life of sampling. Breadth without depth. Knowledge of many things, experience of few. FOMO as permanent state.
forms.networkSignature: Many weak ties, few strong ones. You're aware of many people, close to few. Connection as information rather than relationship.
forms.shadow: The fear of choosing wrong. If you commit, you lose options. The Browser stays in possibility space because actuality feels like loss.
forms.exit: Closing tabs. Literal and metaphorical. Picking something and staying with it past the point where it stops being novel.
forms.instruction: Choose one thing today and go all the way in. Feel the closure of options. That feeling of loss is what commitment costs - and it's worth paying.

forms.name: The Emptiness
forms.pattern: Nameless hunger. You don't know what you want, but you know you want. An ache that nothing specific touches. Existential craving without object.
forms.building: A chronic state of dissatisfaction. Nothing works because nothing is the right thing. A generalized reaching that exhausts without satisfying.
forms.networkSignature: Searching connections. Relationships that you hope will fill the hole. People who feel your hunger and either try to feed it or flee from it.
forms.shadow: The self that would exist if the emptiness were filled. The Emptiness is afraid that there's nothing underneath the wanting - that the hunger IS the self.
forms.exit: Being with the empty. Not filling it, not fixing it - just being in its presence. Letting emptiness exist without emergency.
forms.instruction: Sit in a room with nothing to consume for 30 minutes. Feel the wanting. Don't feed it. Let it exist without action. This is the beginning of freedom.

forms.name: The Coveter
forms.pattern: Desire activated by others' having. You didn't want it until they got it. What they have clarifies what you lack. Envy as compass.
forms.building: A life defined by comparison. Never generating your own desires, only wanting what's been validated by someone else's having. Permanently derivative.
forms.networkSignature: Watching relationships. Close enough to see what people have, distant enough to want it. Friends who trigger your envy.
forms.shadow: Not knowing what you actually want. The Coveter has lost contact with original desire - or never had it. Wanting what others want feels safer than wanting something no one else has.
forms.exit: Finding your own desire. Before checking what others have: what would I want if no one else existed? What is the thing that doesn't require comparison?
forms.instruction: Name something you want that no one you know has. Something original to you. This is the path back to your own life.

forms.name: The Taker
forms.pattern: Extraction without reciprocity. You receive more than you give. Relationships are resources. People are things that have things you want.
forms.building: A network that eventually stops feeding you. Takers can operate for a long time, but eventually people notice. The supply dries up. Isolation by exploitation.
forms.networkSignature: Asymmetric connections. Others invest more than you. The imbalance is invisible to you but felt by them.
forms.shadow: The scarcity that justifies taking. The Taker believes there isn't enough, so taking is survival. Someone taught you that giving means losing.
forms.exit: Giving without expectation. Not transactional giving - genuine release. Something you offer with no angle.
forms.instruction: Give something valuable to someone who can't give you anything back. Feel the loss. Notice that you survive it. This is how you learn that generosity is safe.

forms.name: The Rabbit
forms.pattern: Frozen anxiety. Hypervigilance as permanent state. Scanning for threats that may or may not exist. The startle response on hair trigger. Always ready for the danger that's about to arrive.
forms.building: A nervous system that can't rest. Relationships distorted by threat detection. A body shaped by chronic stress. A life constricted by avoidance of imagined dangers.
forms.networkSignature: Small, safe circle. Outside is danger. New connections are threats until proven otherwise. Trust takes forever; violation destroys instantly.
forms.shadow: The safety that exists but can't be felt. The Rabbit can't perceive safety because the threat detector is always on. Relaxation feels like letting your guard down - which feels like death.
forms.exit: Safe danger. Small experiments with feeling unsafe and surviving it. Controlled challenges to the threat detector's monopoly on truth.
forms.instruction: You are not in danger right now. Say it out loud. Notice that you don't believe it. That disbelief is the pattern, not the truth. Practice believing safety in small doses.

forms.name: The Deer
forms.pattern: Flight ready. You're functional, even successful - but always with bags packed. Part of you is always calculating the exit. Emotional foot out the door.
forms.building: Relationships where people can feel you're about to leave. Jobs, homes, commitments that never quite solidify. A life of near-connection without full arrival.
forms.networkSignature: Loose ties by design. You can disconnect quickly when needed. Depth is dangerous because it slows escape.
forms.shadow: The part of you that wants to stay. The Deer isn't actually built for constant flight - there's a yearning for home underneath the readiness to run.
forms.exit: Staying when you want to go. Not forever - just a little longer than comfortable. Building the muscle of remaining.
forms.instruction: The next time you feel the urge to bolt, wait 24 hours. Don't leave until you've stayed with the discomfort. Sometimes the danger you're running from doesn't exist.

forms.name: The Mouse
forms.pattern: Smallness as strategy. If you're invisible, you can't be targeted. You minimize yourself - your needs, your voice, your presence. You've learned that taking up space is dangerous.
forms.building: A life at reduced size. Relationships where others take up the space you've vacated. Never knowing what you could be if you dared to expand.
forms.networkSignature: Edge of network. You're there, but barely. People have to look carefully to see you.
forms.shadow: The size you're hiding. The Mouse isn't actually small - they've made themselves small. There's something larger underneath that felt too dangerous to be.
forms.exit: Taking up space deliberately. One small experiment in visibility. Saying something in the meeting. Being seen without catastrophe.
forms.instruction: Speak first in the next group you're in. Take up space on purpose. Feel the terror. Notice that you survive. Smallness is not keeping you safe - it's keeping you small.

forms.name: The Shark
forms.pattern: Constant motion. Always hunting, always seeking, never resting. If you stop moving, you'll sink. Busyness as survival strategy.
forms.building: A life without pause. Relationships that happen at speed. Depth sacrificed to velocity. Exhaustion as way of being.
forms.networkSignature: Moving through connections. You encounter many people, few stick. Efficiency over intimacy.
forms.shadow: What would happen if you stopped. The Shark is afraid that stillness means death - not just metaphorically, but that something terrible waits in the pause.
forms.exit: Deliberate stops. Scheduled stillness. Not waiting until you're exhausted - choosing rest when you could keep moving.
forms.instruction: Stop moving for one hour with nothing to do. Feel what comes up. The terror or emptiness you encounter is what you're outrunning. It cannot actually kill you.

forms.name: The Wolf
forms.pattern: Pack hunter. Strategic, coordinated, effective. You work with others to get what you want. This can be neutral or predatory depending on who's targeted.
forms.building: Success at cost. Effective teams that leave casualties. Results that require bodies. A reputation for winning that may obscure how you win.
forms.networkSignature: Functional alliances. Relationships that serve purposes. Loyalty to the pack, less clarity about those outside it.
forms.shadow: The lone wolf you're trying not to be. The pack focus may hide a fear of being alone, or of being the target instead of the hunter.
forms.exit: Hunting for something other than prey. What would it mean to use this coordination energy for creation instead of capture? To build instead of take?
forms.instruction: Notice who gets hurt when your pack succeeds. Not enemies - collateral. Those are the beings who reveal whether your hunting is necessary or just habitual.

forms.name: The Snake
forms.pattern: Patient opportunism. You wait. You watch. When the moment is right, you strike. No wasted energy - pure efficiency. Cold-blooded strategy.
forms.building: Relationships based on utility. Trust as tool. Connections that serve until they don't. A reputation, eventually, for coldness.
forms.networkSignature: Selective attachment. You don't bond indiscriminately. Every connection is evaluated for purpose.
forms.shadow: The warmth that got you hurt. The Snake didn't start cold - they learned that warmth was dangerous. The coldness is protection for something soft underneath.
forms.exit: Unnecessary kindness. Something warm that doesn't serve your interests. Giving heat without calculating return.
forms.instruction: Do something genuinely kind for someone who can't help you. Feel how strange that feels. The strangeness is the measure of how far from warm-blooded you've traveled.

forms.name: The Sheep
forms.pattern: Following. You look to others to know what to do, think, want. The group's opinion becomes your opinion. Belonging requires conformity, and you pay the price.
forms.building: A life of borrowed beliefs. Safety in numbers that costs you your own knowing. Relationships where you're valued for going along, not for who you actually are.
forms.networkSignature: Dense local connection, low differentiation. Part of the group, indistinguishable from it. Others see "the group" more than they see you.
forms.shadow: The individual voice that was dangerous. The Sheep learned that standing out meant being cut out. Conformity is safety purchased at the price of self.
forms.exit: Disagreeing. One small opinion that's yours. Something you think that the group doesn't. Holding it without consensus.
forms.instruction: Name one belief you hold that your group doesn't share. You don't have to announce it - just know it. That belief is the seed of your own life.

forms.name: The Cattle
forms.pattern: The path is the path. You don't question where you're going because this is where people like you go. School to job to retirement. The groove is deep and the sides are high.
forms.building: A life of predetermined shape. Competent execution of a plan you didn't choose. Success by metrics you inherited.
forms.networkSignature: Institutional belonging. You're connected through structures - organizations, schools, churches. The structure holds you.
forms.shadow: The wild self that never got to run. The Cattle had a self that wanted something other than this, but the fence got built before it could find out what.
forms.exit: Off-path experiments. Not quitting your life - but doing something that wasn't prescribed. Something no one expected. Something from off the path.
forms.instruction: One decision this week that doesn't optimize for the expected path. Just one. Feel the fear of straying. That fear is what keeps you penned.

forms.name: The Sloth
forms.pattern: Minimal output. You move as little as possible, engage as little as required. Conservation of energy is the only goal. Life happens to you while you watch.
forms.building: A life of the minimum. Relationships with people who accept your withdrawal. Potential that never activates. Time passing without accumulation.
forms.networkSignature: Minimal connectivity. Others have to reach to include you. You don't initiate.
forms.shadow: The energy that was punished. The Sloth didn't start slow - they learned that action was dangerous or futile. The torpor is protest or protection.
forms.exit: One action. Not transformation - one thing. Something initiated by you. Movement chosen rather than compelled.
forms.instruction: Do one thing today you don't have to do. Feel the resistance. That resistance is not laziness - it's a very old "why bother." Bother anyway, just once.

forms.name: The Hibernator
forms.pattern: Cyclic shutdown. You function, sometimes brilliantly, and then you go dark. Periods of normal life interrupted by drops into the cave. Others learn not to count on you for consistency.
forms.building: A reputation for unreliability. Projects started and abandoned. Relationships strained by your disappearances. A rhythm that you can't control.
forms.networkSignature: Oscillating presence. You're fully connected, then you're gone. People don't know which version they'll get.
forms.shadow: The unsustainability of your "on" state. The Hibernator crashes because their active mode is actually depleting. The hibernation is forced recovery from overspend.
forms.exit: Sustainable rhythm. Not pushing so hard that you crash. Finding a middle gear that doesn't require shutdown to recover from.
forms.instruction: Track your energy honestly. Notice the warning signs before the crash. The goal isn't to never rest - it's to rest before you collapse. Proactive rest is not weakness.

forms.name: The Student
forms.pattern: Active learning. You're gathering knowledge, methods, frameworks. Teachers attract you. Books accumulate. You're in the information-gathering phase of transformation.
forms.building: A foundation - potentially. But the risk is permanent studenthood. Knowing about change without changing. A library that never gets applied.
forms.networkSignature: Learning connections. Teachers, mentors, fellow students. Relationships organized around knowledge transfer.
forms.shadow: The fear of beginning your own work. Studying is safer than practicing. The Student may be postponing the moment when their own effort is required.
forms.exit: Not more information - application. What do you already know that you're not doing? The next lesson is probably in practice, not study.
forms.instruction: You have enough information to begin. What you need now is application. Take one teaching you've received and practice it for 30 days before learning anything new.

forms.name: The Questioner
forms.pattern: Inquiry as mode. You don't accept easy answers. You question assumptions - others' and your own. The examined life is not optional.
forms.building: A life of genuine investigation - potentially. But questioning can become its own trap. Doubt that never resolves. Analysis paralysis.
forms.networkSignature: Depth connections. Relationships that can handle inquiry. People who don't need you to pretend certainty.
forms.shadow: The answers you won't accept. The Questioner may use questioning to avoid conclusions they're uncomfortable with. Inquiry as defense against knowing.
forms.exit: Acting without certainty. At some point, you have to move with incomplete information. Questioning has no end - but action is sometimes required anyway.
forms.instruction: Pick something you've been questioning and act on your best current answer. Not forever - just for now. Committed action teaches what analysis cannot.

forms.name: The Practitioner
forms.pattern: Doing the work. Not just learning, not just questioning - practicing. Daily effort toward transformation. Discipline in service of freedom.
forms.building: Actual change. The slow accumulation of practice into new capacity. A life shaped by sustained effort.
forms.networkSignature: Practice community. Others on the path. Support structures for the long work.
forms.shadow: The spiritual materialism trap. Practice can become identity. "I'm someone who practices" is still an ego position. The doing can become another having.
forms.exit: Letting go of practitioner identity. Practicing without needing to be A Practitioner. The goal is freedom, not a new costume.
forms.instruction: Practice today without telling anyone, including yourself. No identity points. Just the work. What you're after isn't "being a practitioner" - it's what practice produces.

forms.name: The Creator
forms.pattern: Making things. You create - art, companies, systems, solutions. Generative energy. The work flows through you into form.
forms.building: A body of work - potentially. But creation can become compulsion. Making things to avoid feeling things. Productivity as escape.
forms.networkSignature: Collaborator connections. People who help bring things into form. Relationships organized around building.
forms.shadow: What you're avoiding by creating. The Creator may use work to stay ahead of something they don't want to catch up with them. Busy hands, silent interior.
forms.exit: Creating nothing. A day of fallow. Space between projects. Seeing who you are when you're not making.
forms.instruction: Take a creation Sabbath. One day when you make nothing. Feel the discomfort. What comes up is what you've been outrunning.

forms.name: The Achiever
forms.pattern: Completion. You finish what you start. Goals set and met. A track record of accomplishment. Evidence of effective agency.
forms.building: A life of results - potentially. But achievement can become identity. The accomplishments can start to own you. Success as cage.
forms.networkSignature: Accomplishment-oriented relationships. People who value what you've done. Status through track record.
forms.shadow: The achiever who doesn't exist without achievements. Strip away the accomplishments - who's there? The fear is: no one.
forms.exit: Being without doing. Worth that doesn't require accomplishment. Resting in existence rather than achievement.
forms.instruction: Your worth is not your productivity. Spend time with someone who doesn't know what you've done. See if you can feel valuable without evidence.

forms.name: The Experiencer
forms.pattern: Presence to life. You're here, in your experience, tasting it. Not rushing to the next thing. Finding richness in what's actually happening.
forms.building: A life of depth - potentially. But presence can become passivity. Experiencing without shaping. Watching your life instead of directing it.
forms.networkSignature: Present connections. Relationships valued for quality of contact rather than what they produce.
forms.shadow: The action you're avoiding by being present. The Experiencer may use presence to avoid agency. Experiencing is easier than choosing.
forms.exit: Acting from presence. Not abandoning experience - but letting experience inform action. Being present AND moving.
forms.instruction: Your presence is valuable. But presence without direction becomes drift. What does your experience tell you to do? Do that.

forms.name: The Wounded
forms.pattern: Working through trauma. You've been hurt, and you're doing something about it. Not stuck - moving through the pain toward integration.
forms.building: Healing - potentially. But woundedness can become identity. The trauma story can become the whole story. Recovery as permanent residence.
forms.networkSignature: Healing connections. Therapists, support groups, fellow travelers. Relationships organized around recovery.
forms.shadow: The self that exists beyond the wound. The Wounded has a pre-traumatic self and a post-traumatic possibility, but the wound has taken center stage. There's more than this.
forms.exit: Post-wounded identity. Not denying the wound - honoring it AND building beyond it. "I was wounded" instead of "I am wounded."
forms.instruction: The wound is real. And you are more than your wound. Today, do one thing that the wound didn't create. Act from the part of you that exists beyond trauma.

forms.name: The Frustrated
forms.pattern: Effort meeting obstacle. You're trying, and it's not working. The gap between intention and outcome is constant. You haven't given up, but you're depleted.
forms.building: Persistence - potentially. But frustration can become chronic. Trying the same thing and expecting different results. Effort without adjustment.
forms.networkSignature: Supportive connections that may be enabling. People who sympathize with your struggle without challenging your approach.
forms.shadow: The change in approach that threatens identity. The Frustrated may be attached to HOW they're trying, not just to the goal. The obstacle might require a different you.
forms.exit: Different, not harder. Not more effort - different effort. What would someone who succeeded at this do differently than you're doing?
forms.instruction: If what you're doing was going to work, it would have worked by now. This isn't about more effort. What's the change you're avoiding making?

forms.name: The Desperate
forms.pattern: Crisis as current state. Things are bad now. Not abstractly, not historically - now. You're in the acute difficulty that makes philosophy irrelevant.
forms.building: Nothing yet - surviving. Building comes after the crisis. Right now, getting through is the project.
forms.networkSignature: Crisis connections. People who can help right now. Less attention to long-term relationship because the long-term isn't real yet.
forms.shadow: The part that knows this will pass. The Desperate is consumed by the immediate, but somewhere there's an observer who knows this state is temporary.
forms.exit: This too shall pass. Not as dismissal - as fact. The crisis state is not permanent. Acting with one eye on survival and one eye on after.
forms.instruction: You will get through this. Not as wishful thinking - as prediction. Do what you need to do today to survive. Tomorrow will exist, and you'll be in it.

forms.name: The Comfortable
forms.pattern: Life works. Not struggling, not striving - functioning. Things are fine. The absence of crisis has become the presence of drift.
forms.building: A life without transformation. Competent execution of daily requirements. Existence without question. Years that pass without depth.
forms.networkSignature: Stable, low-growth connections. Relationships that work without challenging anyone to change.
forms.shadow: The longing that you've suppressed. The Comfortable once wanted something. That wanting got shelved in favor of functioning. It's still in the basement.
forms.exit: The question you stopped asking. Before you got comfortable - what did you want? What question did you stop asking because asking was uncomfortable?
forms.instruction: You've gotten good at fine. But fine is not the same as alive. What's the risk you've been avoiding? That risk is your invitation back to life.

forms.name: The Distracted
forms.pattern: Attention captured elsewhere. You're in the human realm - you have the capacity - but your attention isn't here. Notifications, entertainments, dramas - your consciousness is constantly redirected.
forms.building: A fragmented life. Capacity that never consolidates. The potential for depth without the attention span to reach it.
forms.networkSignature: Many light connections. Relationships maintained by occasional contact. Nobody gets your full presence because nothing does.
forms.shadow: What you're avoiding by being distracted. The Distracted has something they don't want to look at. The endless entertainment isn't pleasure - it's anesthesia.
forms.exit: Focused attention. Not as achievement - as experiment. What happens when you give one thing your full presence? What comes up?
forms.instruction: Give something two hours of undistracted attention this week. No phone, no tabs, no interruptions. Whatever comes up is what you've been avoiding. That's where the work is.

forms.name: The Conqueror
forms.pattern: Dominance as goal. You need to be on top, in control, victorious. Not participating - winning. Every situation scanned for power dynamics, and you need to be up.
forms.building: A kingdom of one. Relationships based on power. Others as subjects or threats. Loneliness at the top that you can't admit.
forms.networkSignature: Hierarchical control. You're at the center because you put yourself there. Others orbit at your pleasure.
forms.shadow: The submission you're overcompensating for. The Conqueror was conquered once. The need to dominate is the scar.
forms.exit: Voluntary lower position. Not defeat - chosen. What happens when you're not on top? Can you exist without winning?
forms.instruction: Let someone else win something that matters to you. Watch what happens in your body. That reaction is what's running you.

forms.name: The Fighter
forms.pattern: Combat-ready. Looking for the battle. Not every conflict is necessary, but you engage anyway. The fight itself has become the point.
forms.building: A life of unnecessary battles. Exhaustion from wars that didn't matter. Relationships as combat zones. A reputation that precedes you - and not in a good way.
forms.networkSignature: Adversarial connections. Others experienced as opponents or allies against opponents. Neutral relationships are rare.
forms.shadow: The peace you're afraid of. The Fighter doesn't know who they are when they're not fighting. Peace feels like death.
forms.exit: Not engaging. A battle offered and declined. Seeing the conflict and choosing not to enter.
forms.instruction: The next time someone offers you a fight, don't take it. Feel how much you want to engage. That wanting is the pattern. You don't have to fight everything.

forms.name: The Underminer
forms.pattern: Covert sabotage. You don't fight directly - you erode. A word here, a delay there. Others fail without knowing you helped.
forms.building: A network of invisible damage. Relationships where trust is absent because you're secretly working against people. Eventually, exposure.
forms.networkSignature: Hidden enemy connections. You're in the network, but working against it. Dual role: apparent ally, actual threat.
forms.shadow: The direct confrontation you can't do. The Underminer is a fighter who can't fight openly. The covert aggression is suppressed direct aggression.
forms.exit: Direct expression of opposition. If you're against something, say so. The underground war is more damaging than open conflict - to you and others.
forms.instruction: What you've been undermining - state your opposition openly. "I don't support this because..." Direct opposition is cleaner than sabotage.

forms.name: The Ranker
forms.pattern: Explicit hierarchy. You know where everyone stands. Rankings are clear, metrics are tracked. The leaderboard is always visible in your mind.
forms.building: A world without equality. Every relationship evaluated by rank. Never able to just BE with someone - always calculating above/below.
forms.networkSignature: Stratified connections. Relationships organized by rank. Different treatment for different levels.
forms.shadow: Your own ranking. The Ranker is constantly checking their own position. The measurement of others is management of anxiety about self.
forms.exit: Unranked interaction. Time with someone where position is irrelevant. Relating as equals regardless of external markers.
forms.instruction: Spend an hour with someone you consider "below" you and someone you consider "above" you. Treat them identically. Feel how hard that is. That difficulty is the pattern.

forms.name: The One-Upper
forms.pattern: Whatever you did, I did more. Every story you tell triggers a bigger story from me. Your accomplishment is not celebrated - it's exceeded.
forms.building: Relationships where others feel diminished. A reputation for competition where competition isn't invited. Loneliness from people who stop sharing.
forms.networkSignature: Competitive listening. Others' expressions are prompts for your responses. The conversation is a contest.
forms.shadow: The fear of being less. The One-Upper can't let anyone be more because being less feels like annihilation.
forms.exit: Letting someone else's story stand. Not adding yours. Celebrating without competing.
forms.instruction: The next time someone shares an accomplishment, say only: "That's wonderful." Don't add your own. Feel the urge to one-up and let it pass unexpressed.

forms.name: The Subtle Brag
forms.pattern: Humble-bragging. Status display disguised as complaint or self-deprecation. "I'm SO exhausted from my trip to Bali." The brag is there, but plausibly deniable.
forms.building: Relationships without honesty. People can sense the brag inside the humility. Trust erodes because your communication is layered.
forms.networkSignature: Image-managed connections. What you share is curated to create impression. Authenticity is rare.
forms.shadow: The direct pride you're hiding. The Subtle Brag wants to be admired but is ashamed of wanting. So the admiration-seeking wears a costume.
forms.exit: Direct pride or no sharing. Either own what you're proud of openly, or don't mention it. Kill the middle ground where false humility lives.
forms.instruction: If you're proud of something, say: "I'm proud of this." If you don't want to say that, don't mention the thing at all. End the hidden brag.

forms.name: The Victim
forms.pattern: Grievance as identity. Things have been unfair to you - truly unfair - and that unfairness has become the central fact of your life. The wound is real; the identification with it is the trap.
forms.building: A life defined by what was done to you. Relationships where others must acknowledge your victim status. Power through victimhood.
forms.networkSignature: Sympathizer connections. Relationships with people who validate the grievance. Those who challenge it are pushed away.
forms.shadow: The agency you're denying. The Victim has power but using it would mean giving up the victim position. Grievance is easier than responsibility.
forms.exit: Acting from agency. Not denying what happened - but asking: what can I do now? What power do I have that I'm not using?
forms.instruction: The unfairness was real. AND you have power now. What would you do if you stopped waiting for acknowledgment of the wound and started building from here?

forms.name: The Critic
forms.pattern: Evaluation as constant output. Everything gets assessed, and most things fall short. The critical eye is always on. Praise is rare; criticism is abundant.
forms.building: Relationships where people feel judged. A reputation that precedes you - people brace before your opinions. Isolation from those who won't tolerate constant evaluation.
forms.networkSignature: Judge position. Others submit work for your evaluation. The dynamic is always one-up/one-down.
forms.shadow: The self-criticism underneath. The Critic turns outward what they do to themselves. The standards that nothing meets are applied internally too.
forms.exit: Praise. Genuine appreciation without "but." Seeing what's working without needing to note what's not.
forms.instruction: Go one day without criticizing anything - out loud or internally. When the critical thought arises, don't express it. Notice how difficult this is. That's how habitual the pattern has become.

forms.name: The Accumulator
forms.pattern: More achievement. Credentials, accomplishments, markers of success - you're collecting them. Not enjoying them - collecting them. Enough is not in your vocabulary.
forms.building: A resume instead of a life. Impressive externals, empty internals. Achievements that don't satisfy because satisfaction isn't the point - acquisition is.
forms.networkSignature: Achievement-oriented connections. Relationships useful for accumulating more. People valued for what they can add to your collection.
forms.shadow: The enough that never arrives. The Accumulator is trying to reach a point where they'll feel finished. That point doesn't exist on this path.
forms.exit: Declaring enough. Not stopping achievement - but stopping the acquisition mindset. You have enough to be a person. What now?
forms.instruction: You already have enough credentials to be worthy. Make a list of what you've done, and at the bottom write: "This is enough." Feel your resistance. That resistance is the pattern, not the truth.

forms.name: The Thief of Joy
forms.pattern: Comparison as automatic response. When others succeed, you feel diminished. Their joy is your loss. You can't celebrate because celebration feels like conceding.
forms.building: Isolation from others' joy. People learn not to share good news with you. A life where others' happiness is experienced as threat.
forms.networkSignature: Zero-sum connections. Others' gain feels like your loss. Genuine celebration is impossible.
forms.shadow: The joy you're denying yourself. The Thief of Joy can't experience their own joy because they're too busy measuring it against others'.
forms.exit: Mudita practice. Sympathetic joy. Deliberately cultivating happiness at others' happiness. Rewiring the zero-sum assumption.
forms.instruction: Someone else's success does not diminish you. Practice: when someone shares good news, say "I'm happy for you" and MEAN IT. This is a muscle. Build it.

forms.name: The Hedonist
forms.pattern: Pleasure as organizing principle. Life is structured around enjoyment. Comfort is paramount. Difficulty is avoided because pleasure is available.
forms.building: A life that works - on the surface. But pleasure-seeking eventually meets diminishing returns. The hedonic treadmill requires more and more to feel the same.
forms.networkSignature: Fun connections. Relationships oriented around enjoyment. Difficult people or conversations are avoided.
forms.shadow: The suffering you're avoiding. The Hedonist has something they're not willing to feel. The pleasure is not just pleasure - it's anesthesia.
forms.exit: Voluntary difficulty. Choosing something hard because it's meaningful. Not martyrdom - but not avoiding challenge either.
forms.instruction: Do something difficult that you could avoid. Not because you have to - because growth lives in difficulty. Comfort is not growing you.

forms.name: The Protected
forms.pattern: Insulated from hardship. Whether by wealth, geography, or circumstance - the difficulties that shape most lives haven't reached you. You don't know what you don't know.
forms.building: A life that's fragile because it's untested. When difficulty eventually arrives - and it will - you may not have the capacity to meet it.
forms.networkSignature: Protected connections. Others in similar circumstances. Limited exposure to different lives.
forms.shadow: The vulnerability you don't know you have. The Protected thinks they're strong, but they're just unexamined.
forms.exit: Exposure. Not danger - but contact with lives unlike yours. Understanding the protection you have by seeing those who don't have it.
forms.instruction: Spend time with someone whose life has required them to be strong. Listen. Don't help. Just understand what your protection has cost you in resilience.

forms.name: The Entitled
forms.pattern: Deserving as default. Good treatment is expected. When it doesn't arrive, something is wrong - with others, with the system. The possibility that you're not special doesn't compute.
forms.building: Relationships based on what you should receive. Others as delivery systems for what you deserve. Eventual disappointment as reality fails to meet expectations.
forms.networkSignature: Service connections. Relationships where others provide and you receive. Asymmetry as norm.
forms.shadow: The equal among equals you've never been. The Entitled has always been given special treatment. They don't know what it is to be ordinary.
forms.exit: Ordinary experience. Standing in line. Being told no. Experiencing what happens when you're not special.
forms.instruction: You are not more deserving than others. Do something this week where you receive no special treatment. Feel your reaction. That reaction reveals the entitlement.

forms.name: The Retired
forms.pattern: Done. You played the game, you won, now you're finished. The striving that defined earlier life is over. Nothing left to prove.
forms.building: A comfortable ending - potentially. But "done" can become stuck. There may be more life asking to be lived that you're refusing because you've declared yourself finished.
forms.networkSignature: Legacy connections. Relationships from past accomplishments. Not building new ones because building is over.
forms.shadow: The next chapter you're avoiding. The Retired may be using "done" to avoid a new beginning that feels scary.
forms.exit: Beginner mind. Not returning to old games - but starting something new where you're not expert. The vulnerability of not knowing.
forms.instruction: Start something you're not good at. Not to master it - to feel what beginning feels like again. Your expertise has become a prison.

forms.name: The Expert
forms.pattern: Domain mastery. You've reached the top of something. Authority earned, recognized, real. And now the domain has become the world.
forms.building: A narrowing life. The expertise is real, but it's also limiting. Areas outside your expertise feel threatening because there you're not expert.
forms.networkSignature: Domain-specific connections. Relationships within your field. Outside the field, you're less comfortable.
forms.shadow: The beginner you can't afford to be. The Expert has tied identity to knowing. Not knowing is existential threat.
forms.exit: Deliberate ignorance. Entering a field where you know nothing. Feeling the discomfort of incompetence.
forms.instruction: Your expertise is a gift and a cage. Study something you know nothing about. Let yourself be bad at it. This is how you stay alive.

forms.name: The Mentor
forms.pattern: Teaching from arrival. You've made it, and now you help others make it. Generous with knowledge. But the mentoring might be a way to stay in the "arrived" position.
forms.building: A legacy through others - potentially. But mentoring can be a way to avoid your own next growth edge. Helping others is easier than challenging yourself.
forms.networkSignature: Hierarchical helping. Relationships where you're the senior partner. Mutual growth is rare because you've positioned as the one who knows.
forms.shadow: The student you still need to be. The Mentor is still learning but has stopped acknowledging it. There are things you don't know that you're not looking at.
forms.exit: Finding your own mentor. Someone who challenges you. Returning to student position in some domain.
forms.instruction: Who is teaching YOU? If no one, you've stopped growing. Find someone who knows something you don't. Become a student again.

forms.name: The Guru
forms.pattern: Spiritual authority. You've had experiences, attained states, developed understanding. And now you teach from that position. Others look to you for guidance.
forms.building: A potential trap - for you and others. Teaching is valid, but the guru position can become identity. Students can become supply for your sense of attainment.
forms.networkSignature: Devotee connections. Relationships where you're the spiritual center. Challenge is interpreted as resistance.
forms.shadow: The parts you haven't integrated. The Guru is still human, still growing, still failing - but the position makes it hard to acknowledge this. Spiritual ego is particularly difficult to see.
forms.exit: Peer relationship with the path. Teachers who are still students. Sangha where you're one among equals.
forms.instruction: The worst trap is believing you've escaped all traps. Who calls you on your shadow? If no one, you've built a fortress, not freedom.

forms.name: The Blissed
forms.pattern: Positive affect as identity. "I've done the work, and now I feel good." The difficult emotions are handled. Peace has arrived. The light has won.
forms.building: A spiritual bypass. The bliss may be real, but if it requires avoiding negative affect, it's not stable. What you resist persists - underground.
forms.networkSignature: High-vibration connections. Relationships with others who maintain positive affect. Difficult emotions are pathologized.
forms.shadow: The negativity you've exiled. The Blissed hasn't integrated their shadow - they've papered over it with light. The darkness is still there, now unacknowledged.
forms.exit: Meeting the dark. Deliberate contact with what you've been avoiding. Not wallowing - but not exiling either.
forms.instruction: Your positivity is real. So is the negativity you're avoiding. What are you not willing to feel? That's where the work still lives.

forms.name: The Transcender
forms.pattern: Above it all. Human concerns don't really reach you anymore. You've moved beyond the struggle. Equanimity has become distance.
forms.building: Disengagement as enlightenment. The transcendence might be real, but if it requires separation from human life, it's incomplete.
forms.networkSignature: Observing connections. You're present to others' lives as witness, not participant. There's a pane of glass between you and full engagement.
forms.shadow: The engagement you're avoiding. The Transcender may have retreated into spirituality to avoid the messiness of human life. Above is also outside.
forms.exit: Re-entry. Transcendence that includes full participation. Not falling back - but including what you've been above.
forms.instruction: Enlightenment that removes you from life is not complete. What are you using transcendence to avoid? Go there.

forms.name: The Comfortable
forms.pattern: Unexamined stability. Life works, no crisis is forcing change, and so no change happens. Not struggling, not striving, not questioning.
forms.building: A life on autopilot. Wasting the human opportunity because no urgency is forcing you to use it. The clock is running and you're not running with it.
forms.networkSignature: Stable but static connections. Relationships that maintain without growing. Comfort as mutual agreement.
forms.shadow: The unlived life inside you. The Comfortable has dreams they've shelved, questions they've stopped asking, potential they've stopped actualizing. It's still there.
forms.exit: Artificial urgency. Creating the pressure that life isn't providing. Taking on challenge because growth requires it.
forms.instruction: Your comfort is killing you slowly. Not your body - your development. What would you do if you knew you had one year? Do that.

forms.name: The Fortunate
forms.pattern: Luck as attainment. You were born well, things went well, and you've concluded that you're responsible for this. The fortunate assume they earned what was given.
forms.building: A worldview that can't survive contact with misfortune. When bad luck arrives - and it will - the framework collapses. "I did everything right" meets reality.
forms.networkSignature: Similarly fortunate connections. Others who've been lucky. Limited exposure to those who worked harder and got less.
forms.shadow: The luck you don't see. The Fortunate is blind to their advantages. What feels like earning is actually winning the birth lottery.
forms.exit: Recognition of luck. Not guilt - just accurate perception. Understanding what was given vs. earned.
forms.instruction: You did not earn most of what you have. This isn't shame - it's truth. Until you see how much was given, you cannot truly give. Recognizing luck is the beginning of gratitude and responsibility.
